alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Ulster and northwestern Dutchess Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over High Falls, or 7 miles southwest of Kingston, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Rhinebeck, Hurley, Red Hook, High Falls, Lake Katrine, Staatsburg, Tillson, Olivebridge, Port Ewen, Esopus, Rosendale, Marbletown, Milan, Rolling Meadows, Norrie Heights, Kerleys Corners, Maple Hill, Atwood and Pacama. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
